summary: results Synthesis and detection of N6-methyladenosine (m6A)25. the modification found internally in the mRNA of many eukaryotes26,27,28,29. this method was modified to label and detect only the first nucleotide after the cap. all oligoribonucleotides were synthesized using the standard protocol for solid-phase RNA synthesis with a 15 min coupling time per nucleotide. the last coupling step was followed by a standard DMTr-off procedure, the oligonucleotides were removed from the solid support, deprotected, precipitated and desalted. oligonucleotides SK-526 (m6Am) and SK-524 (Am) were mixed in ratios of 5:1, 2:1, 1:1, 1:2 and 1:5, end labelled using T4 polynucleotide kinase. the calculated percentage of m6Am closely matched the actual m6Am percentage. m6Am:pAm ratios are between 15:1 (brain) and 2:1 (liver) m6Am is more prevalent at the cap1 than Am. mRNA from liver and testis was assayed on the first transcribed nucleotide. de-capped and end-labelled DNA targets were first cross-linked to 2 mm 2 mm teeth cut from a Hybond N+ membrane. the individual teeth containing the labelled mRNA gene-specific fragments were then removed and digested to nucleotide 5' monophosphates using P1 nuclease. testis tissues almost exclusively had m6Am at the cap adjacent position. this was four times larger than the m6Am:Am ratio for the testis mRNA population as a whole. the cap adjacent nucleotides of pabpc1 transcripts were predominantly unmodified. the oligoribonucleotides were synthesized using the standard protocol for solid-phase RNA synthesis with a 15 min coupling time per nucleotide. the last coupling step was followed by a standard DMTr-off procedure, the oligoribonucleotides were removed from the solid support, deprotected and precipitated. the oligonucleotides SK-524 and SK-526 were mixed in ratios of 5:1, 2:1, 1:1, 1:2 and 1:5, end labelled using T4 polynucleotide kinase, digested to 5' mononucleotides and separated by TLC. the resulting spots were quantified using phosphorimaging. mRNA transcripts were radiolabelled at their 5' end using T4 polynucleotide kinase. the labelled RNA was digested to monophospho-nucleotides by P1 nuclease. new spots corresponding to the 2'-O methylated nucleotides are apparent in the labelled samples after cap removal. single stranded DNA from yeast gene IME2 was used as a negative control DNA in the hybridisations. mRNA from liver and testis was de-capped and end-labelled as described above then fragmented to 120 nt. this was then hybridised to single stranded DNA targets corresponding to the 5' region of selected messages. mRNA targets were cross-linked to 2 mm 2 mm teeth cut from a Hybond N+ membrane. the labelled nucleotide in the cap adjacent position included A, G, U and C, as well as m6Am and Am. this is consistent with multiple alternative transcription start sites at and around the Inr32. in both cases, Am and m6Am appeared as the major nucleotide modifications. most genes will give rise to a population of mRNAs that differ in their starting nucleotides. for example the Prm2 message initiates predominantly at the central A of the Inr as well as a second A 3 nucleotides upstream.
